pages.text: The $(thing)Nickel-Iron Battery$() is a storage method for $(thing)FE$(). Maximum capacity of $(thing)2,000 FE$(). Maximum transfer rate of $(thing)20 FE per tick$().$(br2)Fixed output on the top of the battery, input on the bottom.$(br2)To toggle automatic power output to neighboring blocks, press the $(thing)Toggle$() button.
Energy is retained when the block is mined.

The $(thing)Zinc-Silver Battery$() is an upgraded storage method for $(thing)FE$(). Maximum capacity of $(thing)5,000 FE$(). Maximum transfer rate of $(thing)50 FE per tick$().$(br2)Fixed output on the top of the battery. All other sides input.$(br2)To toggle automatic power output to neighboring blocks, press the $(thing)Toggle$() button.
Energy is retained when the block is mined.$(br2)The $(thing)Zinc-Silver Battery$() can be read by comparators.

$(thing)Power Conduits$() can be set up to move energy longer distances. $(item)$(k:key.use)$() while holding a $(thing)Hammer$() on a conduit to turn on/off extract mode.$(br2)Conduits set to extract can only $(bold)drain$() FE storages, not fill them, and cannot connect to other conduits set to extract.
Power conduits are crafted from copper on an $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$().
$(thing)Encased Power Conduits$() are full blocks; useful for passing conduits through walls, floors, or ceilings.$(br2)Encased power conduits act exactly the same as normal power conduits.
